org.fhnw.aigs.swingClient.GUI

Class SettingsWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • org.fhnw.aigs.swingClient.GUI.SettingsWindow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class SettingsWindow
extends javax.swing.JDialog
    This class is responsible for checking the identity of a player and the client settings.
    The following text is deprecated (from v1.0)
    In order to start a game, a client must first be identified. This happens with the help of the IdentificationMessage. This message needs a user name and an identification code. In a first attempt, the BaseClients mechanisms will try to use a file called aigs.user located in the base folder of the game.
    If there is no such file, this dialogue will be shown, asking the user to enter the name and the identification code. If the identification process is successful, the credentials will be saved in abovementioned file.
    Later on, this dialogue should not be displayed anymore.
    Version:
    1.1 (Raphael Stoeckli)
    Author:
    Matthias St√∂ckli
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
